clinical_note.text: Subjective: 65-year-old male presents for a routine annual checkup. History of DM2 for 10 years, managed with Metformin. Patient reports mild fatigue but denies chest pain or shortness of breath. Noticed occasional peripheral edema in bilateral ankles in the evening. Objective: BP 148/92, HR 76, Temp 98.4. Lungs clear to auscultation. 1+ pitting edema noted at the ankles. Assessment: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus with borderline hypertension. Plan: Order BMP to monitor kidney function and HbA1c to assess glycemic control. Adjust lisinopril if blood pressure remains elevated.
